result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas O Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(c)-Possession of Cocaine (2+)It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Status conference at 10-26-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Nicholas O Nelson in court with attorney Christy M Hall.  Defendant Nicholas O Nelson in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Ms. Hall was retained as of last night. In 15CF1076, defense asks that cash bail be increased. In 15CF1220, defense asks that no contact be lifted with victim to allow telephone visitation as well as jail visitation.
The State does not object to increase in bond. The State indicates that Ms. Tanck-Adams, who is the prosecutor, has ordered the 911 call and therefore, Mr. Repischak objects to the no contact order being lifted.

BTC: In 15CF1076, bond to be increased to $450.00. In 15CF1220, bond modification is denied  Status conference scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
